solution_line_template: Rich walks {initial_walk_to_sidewalk}+{walk_down_sidewalk}= <<{initial_walk_to_sidewalk}+{walk_down_sidewalk}={distance_to_end_of_road}>>{distance_to_end_of_road} feet to get to the end of the road.

He then walks double that distance, {distance_to_end_of_road}*{double_factor}= <<{distance_to_end_of_road}*{double_factor}={distance_to_next_intersection}>>{distance_to_next_intersection} feet to the next intersection.

This makes a total of {distance_to_end_of_road}+{distance_to_next_intersection}= <<{distance_to_end_of_road}+{distance_to_next_intersection}={total_distance_so_far_after_intersection}>>{total_distance_so_far_after_intersection} feet.

He then walks half that distance, {total_distance_so_far_after_intersection}/{half_factor}= <<{total_distance_so_far_after_intersection}/{half_factor}={distance_to_end_of_route}>>{distance_to_end_of_route} feet to get to the end of his route.

This makes a total of {total_distance_so_far_after_intersection}+{distance_to_end_of_route}=<<{total_distance_so_far_after_intersection}+{distance_to_end_of_route}={total_distance_one_way}>>{total_distance_one_way} feet so far.

He then walks that same distance back, for a total of {total_distance_one_way}*{return_factor}= <<{total_distance_one_way}*{return_factor}={total_walked_distance}>>{total_walked_distance} feet in total.
